alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 26 at 2:13AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. Heavy snow, blowing snow, and near-blizzard conditions possible. * WHERE...South Laramie Range Foothills and Central Laramie County including Cheyenne. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. The worst conditions are expected through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and near-zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow. High winds will be especially dangerous to light weight and high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Storm Warning is also in effect for central Laramie County. Please refer to the appropriate hazard product for more details.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
